      • setBusinessPassword

        protected final NextCommandReply setBusinessPassword(String arg0)
                                              throws Reply421Exception
        Description copied from class: FilesystemBasedAuthImpl
        Set the password according to any implementation and could set the rootFromAuth. If NOOP is returned, isIdentifed must be TRUE.
        Specified by:
        setBusinessPassword in class FilesystemBasedAuthImpl
        Returns:
        (NOOP, 230) if the Password is OK, else return the following command that must follow (usually ACCT) and the associated reply
        Throws:
        Reply421Exception - if there is a problem during the authentication

      • connection

                                byte[] arg0,
                                boolean isSsl)
                         throws Reply530Exception,
                                Reply421Exception
        Parameters:
        hostId -
        arg0 -
        Returns:
        True if the connection is OK (authentication is OK)
        Throws:
        Reply530Exception - if the authentication is wrong
        Reply421Exception - If the service is not available

      • setRootFromAuth

        protected final void setRootFromAuth()
                              throws Reply421Exception
        Set the root relative Path from current status of Authentication (should be the highest level for the current authentication). If setBusinessRootFromAuth returns null, by default set /user.
        Overrides:
        setRootFromAuth in class FilesystemBasedAuthImpl
        Throws:
        Reply421Exception - if the business root is not available

      • setBusinessRootFromAuth

        protected final String setBusinessRootFromAuth()
                                        throws Reply421Exception
        Specified by:
        setBusinessRootFromAuth in class FilesystemBasedAuthImpl
        Returns:
        the root relative path from authentication if any or null if the default is used (default is /user or /user/account)
        Throws:
        Reply421Exception - if the business root is not available

      • setBusinessUser

        protected final NextCommandReply setBusinessUser(String arg0)
                                          throws Reply421Exception
        Description copied from class: FilesystemBasedAuthImpl
        Set the user according to any implementation and could set the rootFromAuth. If NOOP is returned, isIdentifed must be TRUE.
        Specified by:
        setBusinessUser in class FilesystemBasedAuthImpl
        Returns:
        (NOOP, 230) if the user is OK, else return the following command that must follow (usually PASS) and the associated reply
        Throws:
        Reply421Exception - if there is a problem during the authentication

      • connectionHttps

        public final boolean connectionHttps(String hostId,
                                     byte[] arg0)
                              throws Reply530Exception,
                                     Reply421Exception
        connection from HTTPS (no default rights, must be set either as admin or specifically through ROLEs). Only "false client" with port with negative values are allowed.
        Parameters:
        hostId -
        arg0 -
        Returns:
        True if the connection is OK (authentication is OK)
        Throws:
        Reply530Exception - if the authentication is wrong
        Reply421Exception - If the service is not available
